newsitem.title: USA: NBA basketball-HEAT BEAT THE KNICKS TO FORCE SEVENTH GAME.
newsitem.headline: NBA basketball-HEAT BEAT THE KNICKS TO FORCE SEVENTH GAME.

text.p: Tim Hardaway and Dan Majerle combined for 16 points in an 18-7 fourth-quarter run to lead the Miami Heat to a 95-90 victory over the New York Knicks on Friday and to force a seventh game in their Eastern Conference semifinal series.
Game Seven will be Sunday in Miami. The winner will play the Chicago Bulls in the East finals.
Six players were suspended for Friday's game after a brawl in Wednesday's game in Miami.
The Heat played without starting power forward P.J. Brown, who will also miss Game Seven.

The Knicks were without their top two scorers -- Patrick Ewing and Allan Houston -- and reserve point guard Charlie Ward for Game Six. New York will be without starting forward Larry Johnson and guard John Starks for Game Seven.
Alonzo Mourning led Miami with 28 points and nine rebounds. Hardaway had 20 points and Majerle finished with 18.
Chris Childs led the Knicks with 22 points and Johnson added 20.
Despite the absence of Ewing, Houston and Ward, the Knicks led by as many as 10 points after the first quarter and led 44-40 at halftime.

Miami tied the game, 64-64, on a three-point play by Isaac Austin with 51 seconds left in the third quarter and took the lead, 68-67, on a dunk by Jamal Mashburn with 9:36 remaining in the fourth quarter.
But Johnson converted a three-point play and Charles Oakley hit a corner jumper to give New York a 72-68 advantage.
Hardaway then started the decisive 18-7 run with a three-pointer with 7:12 left.
